title: Hotdog-Sandwich Unification Framework

steps.action: Establish a joint Hotdog-Sandwich Taxonomy Commission
prerequisites: Secure buy-in from key stakeholder groups
steps.outcome: Authoritative body to define taxonomic standards and resolve disputes
risks: Difficulty achieving consensus on commission membership and decision-making process

prerequisites: Conduct research on structural, cultural, and culinary factors
steps.outcome: Taxonomic framework that respects both structural and cultural perspectives
risks: Difficulty reconciling competing definitions and viewpoints
Potential for unintended consequences or loopholes

steps.action: Implement a Hotdog-Sandwich Dispute Resolution Mechanism
steps.outcome: Formal process for peacefully resolving classification disputes
risks: Pushback from ideological camps unwilling to compromise

steps.action: Develop educational campaigns and public outreach
prerequisites: Taxonomy and dispute resolution mechanisms in place
steps.outcome: Increased public awareness and acceptance of the unified framework
risks: Difficulty cutting through existing biases and misinformation

steps.action: Integrate the Hotdog-Sandwich Taxonomy into regulations, standards, and industry practices
prerequisites: Public buy-in and acceptance of the framework
Cooperation from relevant regulatory bodies and industry groups
steps.outcome: Practical implementation and consistent application of the taxonomy
risks: Resistance from industries and regulators unwilling to change existing practices
Challenges in updating legacy systems and infrastructure

resource_requirements: Funding for Taxonomy Commission and public outreach
Expertise in food science, culinary history, taxonomy, and dispute resolution
Cooperation from key stakeholder groups and regulatory bodies
